alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 4:58PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Douglas, east central Chelan and southwestern Okanogan Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 457 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Chelan to near Orondo. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chelan, Douglas, Waterville, Entiat, Stayman, Manson, and Lake Chelan State Park. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 142 and 154. U.S. Highway 97 in Washington between mile markers 215 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
